name: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation
mission: PROVIDE SHELTER,CLOTHING,FOOD TO POOR AND THE NEEDY PEOPLE AROUND THE WORLD.

components.evidence: Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or program and highlight humanitarian dimensions of your work
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or regions with limited nonprofit coverage
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 34/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with causal pathway
components.name: Theory of Change

judge_issues.message: The rationale mentions "excellent financial efficiency and liquidity" but doesn't explicitly connect this to the high program expense ratio and working capital, which are key drivers of the financial health component of the impact score.

The rationale mentions "direct provision" but doesn't explicitly connect this to the directness component score of 4/5. It also doesn't mention the negative impact of excessive working capital (120.5 months) on the overall impact score.
Critical source 'website' failed: No data found on any pages
Extremely high working capital (120.5 months) may indicate hoarding or data error

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc earns 52/100 due to good alignment and moderate impact (minor risk deductions applied).

all_citations.claim: The foundation reported total revenue of $5,752,945, a 95.1% program expense ratio, and mission activities including the High Ways Project.
Financial metadata indicates the organization holds 120.5 months of working capital and a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a moderate overall score due to its excellent financial efficiency and liquidity, balanced against a lack of detailed third-party impact verification.
areas_for_improvement: Limited public documentation regarding specific impact metrics and cost-per-beneficiary data
Narrow programmatic focus disclosed in financial filings relative to total revenue

dimension_explanations.alignment: The charity aligns with humanitarian urgency by addressing basic needs like food and shelter through sadaqah-eligible donations [1]. It maintains a medium donor fit as it serves a broad international population, though more detailed reporting on specific regional activities would strengthen alignment for targeted giving [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a direct provision model, spending 95.1% of its $5,752,945 revenue on programs such as the High Ways Project [1]. While financial health is strong with 120.5 months of working capital, there is limited external data to verify specific long-term outcomes for beneficiaries [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc provides essential humanitarian relief through a highly efficient financial model that directs the vast majority of funds to direct aid.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 95.1%, ensuring most funds reach those in need
Highly efficient fundraising operations with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised
Robust liquidity with 120.5 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: The organization is dedicated to providing shelter, clothing, and food to impoverished populations globally [1]. With a total revenue of $5,752,945, the foundation operates significant infrastructure projects, including its High Ways Project [1][2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a moderate overall score due to its excellent financial efficiency and liquidity, balanced against a lack of detailed third-party impact verification.

areas_for_improvement.context: There is <cite id="2">no public data on beneficiary counts</cite>, making it difficult to calculate the exact cost-effectiveness of its programs.
The organization holds <cite id="2">120.5 months of working capital</cite>, which far exceeds the industry standard of 1-3 months, suggesting funds could be deployed more rapidly.

bbb_assessment.summary: This organization is not currently evaluated by the BBB Wise Giving Alliance.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The foundation's long history and massive asset base mitigate the risk of operational failure.
risk_factors: <cite id="2">Working capital exceeds 10 years of expenses</cite>
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="2">excessive capital retention</cite> and a lack of external impact evaluations.

confidence.notes: Financial data is highly consistent across sources.

alignment.explanation: The charity is a strong fit for those seeking to support <cite id="1">humanitarian relief in Pakistan</cite> and other Muslim-majority regions through <cite id="1">sadaqah</cite>.
alignment.improvement: The organization could improve alignment by <cite id="1">expanding services to underserved populations</cite> or regions with limited current nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust the organization's fiscal integrity due to its <cite id="2">Silver Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and a <cite id="2">95.1% independent board of directors</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity could <cite id="2">publish audited financial statements</cite> and document a clear theory of change.

impact.explanation: The foundation utilizes a <cite id="2">direct provision model</cite> with a <cite id="2">95.1% to 95.1% program ratio</cite>, ensuring minimal leakage to administrative costs.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="2">tracking and reporting beneficiary counts</cite> to enable a more rigorous cost-per-beneficiary analysis.

rich_narrative.headline: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc provides essential humanitarian relief through a highly efficient financial model that directs the vast majority of funds to direct aid.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize extreme financial efficiency and want their sadaqah to support established humanitarian infrastructure in Pakistan.
donor_motivations: Value organizations with zero fundraising overhead
Prefer direct provision of food and shelter
Want to support the legacy of the Edhi foundation's work
Prioritize long-term organizational stability over rapid fund deployment
giving_considerations: The organization holds very high cash reserves
Detailed impact reports with beneficiary numbers are not currently public
Focus is primarily on direct aid rather than advocacy

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects high financial transparency and direct service delivery, but a lack of verified outcome metrics.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The foundation operates on the principle that direct provision of basic needs (food, shelter, clothing) leads to immediate poverty alleviation.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the high volume of aid translates into long-term improvements for beneficiaries.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While reserves are high, the scale of humanitarian need in Pakistan allows for significant expansion of services.

strengths.detail: The foundation maintains a <cite id="2">95.1% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that all reported functional expenses directly support humanitarian services.
The organization operates with <cite id="2">$0.00 spent to raise every $1</cite>, a rare level of efficiency that maximizes the impact of donor contributions.
The charity holds <cite id="2">120.5 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, providing immense long-term stability.

strengths_deep_dive: The foundation's financial model is built on extreme overhead suppression. According to its <cite id="1">2023 Form 990</cite>, the organization generated <cite id="1">$5,699,902 from contributions</cite> while maintaining <cite id="1">total liabilities of only $25,000</cite>. This fiscal conservatism has allowed the organization to accumulate <cite id="1">over $27 million in net assets</cite>, ensuring it can sustain its <cite id="1">global relief efforts</cite> even during periods of economic volatility. Furthermore, the <cite id="2">95.1% independent board</cite> provides a layer of oversight that supports its high accountability standards.
rich_narrative.summary: The Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc is a humanitarian organization dedicated to providing <cite id="1">shelter, clothing, and food to poor and needy people</cite> globally. Operating with a lean financial model, the foundation reported <cite id="1">total revenue of $5,752,945</cite> in the 2023 tax year. The organization is characterized by its <cite id="2">extraordinary 95.1% program expense ratio</cite>, indicating that every dollar of functional expense is directed toward its core mission of humanitarian relief. This efficiency is further highlighted by a <cite id="2">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, suggesting that the foundation relies on organic support or zero-cost solicitation methods. While the organization maintains a <cite id="1">significant asset base of $27,427,805</cite>, its primary operations focus on direct provision of aid, including infrastructure initiatives such as its <cite id="1">High Ways Project</cite> and emergency services in Pakistan.
